revised_title: Vibrational Excitation of N2O in Nitrogen Atoms Reaction with NO2
tldr: The authors studied the reaction of nitrogen atoms with NO2 to form vibrationally excited N2O molecules. They found that almost all N2O molecules were vibrationally excited, with energy from the reaction entering all three vibration modes. This research provides insights into the partitioning of energy in chemical reactions and the formation of vibrationally excited molecules.
